mechanics.condition: Target is a creature or object you can see within spell's range
mechanics.outcome: A primary target is chosen for the lightning bolt

mechanics.condition: Up to three other creatures or objects are within 30 feet of the primary target
mechanics.outcome: Up to three secondary targets are chosen, each hit by a separate bolt

mechanics.condition: A creature or object has already been targeted by any bolt from this casting of Chain Lightning
mechanics.outcome: That creature or object cannot be targeted again by another bolt from this casting

mechanics.trigger: A target is hit by a lightning bolt
mechanics.condition: Target is a creature or object
mechanics.outcome: Target must make a Dexterity saving throw

description_text: You create a bolt of lightning that arcs toward a target of your choice that you can see within range. Three bolts then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the bolts. A target must make a dexterity saving throw. The target takes 10d8 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
